ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Sometimes my sense of touch is particularly sensitive.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Every now and then clothing seems uncomfortable and abrasive on my skin. Real touch seems more intense
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: There are times when I feel overwhelmed by physical sensations. Feelings of being flooded/inundated by real tactile experiences
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: I tend to notice the slightest touches against my skin.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: I find it difficult to discriminate between multiple sources of physical sensation. Cannot focus attention on one real tactile sensation to the exclusion of others
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Some days my sense of smell is particularly sensitive to odors or perfumes. Real smells are perceived with increased intensity
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: I have feelings of being flooded or permeated by odors or smells. Smells everything at once.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Sometimes it is hard to discriminate between multiple sensations of smells. Cannot focus on one real smell to the exclusion of others
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: My sense of taste is much better than others. Real tastes are perceived with increased intensity
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: At times I have feelings of being flooded by certain tastes.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: I sometimes find it difficult to distinguish between different sensations of taste.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Normal noises (i.e., auto & air traffic, motorized appliances, speech) are perceived with increased intensity. Sounds are perceived as painfully loud.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Feelings of being flooded/inundated by real sounds. All sounds seem to come in at once.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Cannot focus attention on one real sound or voice to the exclusion of others. Unable to focus on only one sound and ignore others.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Real sights or colors seem unusually intense. Lights seem much brighter. The intensity of colors is greater
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Feelings of being flooded/inundated by sights or colors. Complex visual environments are bothersome.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: Cannot focus attention on one visual perception to the exclusion of others. Cannot attend to one of many simultaneous visual inputs.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Almost Never; 2= Rarely True; 3= Often True; 4= Almost Always; 5= Always True

ElementDescription: SIAPA Auditory Mean score
SIAPA Visual Mean Score
SIAPA Tactile Mean Score
SIAPA Olfactory Mean Score
SIAPA Gustatory Mean Score
Form used/assessment name
